snippet.title: Baker McKenzie promotes Aussie to oversee Asia-Pac TMT
snippet.content:
Baker McKenzie partner Adrian Lawrence has been tapped to take over as technology, media and telecommunications group leader for the Asia-Pacific. The Sydney-based Lawrence joined Baker McKenzie two decades ago and has been a partner since 1997. He previously worked as a research director at the Supreme Court of NSW. Lawrence regularly acts for a number of major Silicon Valley-based online platforms as well as other leading technology and media interests such as the Motion Picture Association, HT&E (previously APN) and the ABC. He has also been active in the Australian fintech market with clients such as SocietyOne, OnDeck and Acorns.
Lawrence is the second Sydney-based TMT lawyer at Baker McKenzie to get tapped.
In April, , formally senior counsel at Nine Entertainment, was elevated to national head of intellectual property, technology, media and content at the law firm.
